wikipedia_page.main: William Bannister (1879 – 25 March 1942) was an English professional footballer who played as a defender for Burnley, Bolton Wanderers, Woolwich Arsenal and Leicester Fosse. Bannister also played at international level, earning two caps with the English national side between 1901 and 1902.

Footballers can be called up to represent their national team in a senior international match; a total of 90 players have won at least one cap for their country in senior international football while playing for Burnley, representing 19 nations. In March 1889, John Yates became the first Burnley player to be capped when he appeared for England against Ireland in the 1888–89 British Home Championship; Yates scored a hat-trick in what proved to be his only international match.Simpson (2007), p. 538 Two Burnley-born players have won caps for the English national team while at the club: Jimmy Crabtree in 1894 and 1895 and Billy Bannister in 1901.Simpson (2007), p. 485 Tommy Morrison became the club's first non-English international when he played for Ireland against Wales in 1899.Simpson (2007), p. 537 In 2001, Trinidad and Tobago international Ian Cox became the first Burnley player to represent a country from outside the British Isles.Simpson (2007), p. 532 The only decade during which the club did not have an international representative was the 1990s.Simpson (2007), pp. 532–538
